item.title: Blog Post
item.description: Intro In this blog post, I will be examining the sleep data of mammals. Animals have always interested me, so I want to take a look at some characteristics of their sleep data. I will conduct this task by using both R and Python code chunks. Code library(ggplot2) library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ tibble 3.0.3 ✓ dplyr 1.0.1 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.1 ✓ stringr 1.

item.title: Project1
item.description: Shivani Kottur, ssk2425 Introduction This project is all about analyzing characteristics of dogs. The first dataset, "dog_intelligence," is about different breeds of dogs and their mental characteristics. Its variables include the dog breed, their intelligence classification, the probability that the breed obeys the first command given, as well as the upper and lower limits of repetitions for the breed to understand any new commands. The second dataset, "AKC_Breed_Info," is about different breeds of dogs and their physical characteristics.

item.title: Project2
item.description: Shivani Kottur, ssk2425 Introduction This project involves the dogs dataset, which includes certain mental and physical characteristics of numerous dog breeds. Specifically, the dataset contains variables representing the breeds ("Breed"), their intelligence level classifications ("Classification"), the upper and lower limits of repetitions necessary to understand commands ("reps_lower", "reps_upper"), and the upper and lower limits of height and weight ("height_low_inches", "height_high_inches", "weight_low_lbs", "weight_high_lbs"). In total, there are 104 observations. 1.
